Vocabulary.Meat: The flesh of an animal used as food.
Vocabulary.Shadow: A dark shape made by something blocking light.
Vocabulary.Lost: No longer in possession of something.

Sentences.Text: One day, a Dog was walking across a bridge.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Where do you think the Dog is going?
FunQuestions: Have you seen a dog on a bridge?
What do dogs like to carry?

Sentences.Text: He had a big piece of meat in his mouth.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Dog will do with the meat?
FunQuestions: What do dogs like to eat?
Have you seen a dog carrying something?

Sentences.Text: When he looked down at the water, he saw his shadow.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Dog saw in the water?
FunQuestions: What happens when you look at water?

Sentences.Text: The Dog thought it was another dog with a bigger piece of meat.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: Why do you think the Dog wanted the other piece of meat?
FunQuestions: Why do you think shadows look real?

Sentences.Text: He opened his mouth to grab it, and his own meat fell into the water.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What do you think the Dog felt when his meat fell?
FunQuestions: What would you do if you were the Dog?

Sentences.Text: The Dog was sad. He lost the meat he had because he wanted more.
Sentences.InteractionPrompt: What lesson do you think the Dog learned?
FunQuestions: What does it mean to want too much?
